issues.title: xsconsole bug in "All VMs": Unable to view All VMs in the xsconsole
issues.body:
I am running  XenServer 6.0.0-50762p with ca 30 VMs. When using xsconsole->Virtual Machines->All VMs i get the answer "This feature is unavailable in Pools with more than 100 Virtual Machines".
This obvious bug isrelated to 
https://github.com/xenserver/xsconsole/blob/master/plugins-base/XSFeatureVMInfo.py#L102, def AllActivateHandler(cls)
where 100 is hard-coded in the function. Probably lambda x: x.xenapi.VM.get_all() counts wrong.

commits.message:
[CP-18907] Eliminate spurious stack traces from log files

The `Data.Update` method was checking the validity of SR references
triggering a long list of hard-to-debug (but benign) errors during
xapi init phase. This can be often avoided by making sure that the
reference is not `OpaqueRef:NULL`. The additional log is to make
it easier to debug similar errors in the future.

I am assuming that we need to support Python 2.4, so I avoided
using the ternary operator.

Signed-off-by: Marcello Seri marcello.seri@citrix.com

review_comments.body: Is `var = stg if property else stg_else` fine or we need to run this code on some very old legacy python version?
To integrate my question: the ternary operator was added in python 2.5, released in September 2006.

CA-121667 Fix DeprecationWarning when running on newer Python versions

popen2 has been deprecated on newer Python versions and generates a warning when xsconsole starts.
We always run on Python 2.4 or later, so we are safe to move to using the subprocess module in all cases.

pull_requests.title: CA-121667 Fix DeprecationWarning when running on newer Python versions
pull_requests.body:
popen2 has been deprecated on newer Python versions and generates a warning when xsconsole starts.
We always run on Python 2.4 or later, so we are safe to move to using the subprocess module in all cases.

commits.message: CP-5046: Adding INSTALL & README files.
CP-5046: Initial changes to make Makefile build correctly for Git instead of HG
Merge by b2bmerge!
CA-74932: update network reset for networkd
Network reset: improved wording
CA-69997: another try
Network reset: display the master IP dialogue after specifying static IP
CA-69997: Ensure that xsconsole does not become unresponsive when running on a slave and the master is unreachable. Revert to the reduced-functionality mode in this case.
Emergency network reset: add warning page and select mgmt interface by device name rather than MAC
CP-1571: Add Emergency Network Reset plugin

CA-54633: Handle case where dmidecode duplicates tables

Sometimes dmidecode generates more than one copy of a table.  Cope
with this by ignoring a table if already seen.  (Each table is headed
by a unique 'Handle'.)

Signed-off-by: Alex Zeffertt <alex.zeffertt@eu.citrix.com>
CP-1912: Update xsconsole banner to use textual version

CA-40744: Add "<F5> Refresh" to help text

When pane on right is scrollable.
CA-23755: Print meaningful error message if xsconsole exits due to screen resize

CA-43580: Improve xsconsole error message

The "Enter Maintenance Mode" feature can fail whilst migrating running
VMs if the other host(s) in the pool do not have enough memory
available.  In this circumstance XAPI will through a
"HOST_NOT_ENOUGH_FREE_MEMORY" error.

Previously this was translated by xsconsole as 'Not enough host memory
is available to perform this operation'.  This was confusing users,
because it didn't say what needed to be done to remedy the situation.

I have replaced this with the text 'Not enough host memory available,
please shutdown or suspend some VMs'.
CA-41854: Support operations on SRs and VMs with multibyte character names

CA-41440: Replace 'Add/Remove DNS Servers' menu item with 'Display DNS Servers'

Remove the ability to modify the list of DNS servers as it was broken
and unneccessary.  The DNS configuration can be done from XenCenter or
from the CLI, and it is not neccessary for the DNS config to be correct
in order to get access via XenCenter or via ssh.

The reason this feature was broken is that it simply modified
/etc/resolv.conf, but this file is auto-generated.

For the record:
 /etc/resolv.conf is auto-generated by dhclient-script, or or by
 ifup-post  when it brings up the interface used for peer DNS (this is
 either the PIF with PIF.other-config.peerdns=true or the management
 PIF).  For static peer DNS interfaces the nameservers are taken from
 the comma seperated list in PIF.DNS.  For DHCP peer DNS interfaces
 the nameservers are those provided by the DHCP server, followed by
 the comma seperated list in PIF.DNS.

CA-30853: Display proper error message when trying to eject from single host pool

It should say that this host is the master of the pool instead of
saying it is not a member of a pool.

Note: The only way you can tell the difference between a single host
pool and not being a pool member at the moment is to check
db.local_pool.name_label() which will be clear if not a pool member.

CA-40850: Fix typo that caused xsconsole crashes when tasks were cancelled

Thanks to "Reid Price" <reid@nicira.com> for debugging this.

CA-35709: Make xsconsole consistent with XenCenter regarding SRs

 * Collect Equalogic and Netapp under submenu as in XenCenter
 * reorder SR types as per XenCenter
 * rename SR types as per XenCenter
 * Updated help text for Hardware HBA SRs
CA-37850: Improve error message when operation cannot be performed whilst joined to AD domain

CA-27885: Ignore stderr from xe-restore-metadata unless it returns non-zero

If xe-restore-metadata returns 0 then XSFeatureDRRestore.py expects
the expects the output to be a vdi-uuid.  Do not combine stderr with
stdout as this will result in corrupted vdi-uuids.

CA-30843: Fix Specify Suspend SR/Crash Dump SR

We need to set the values on the Pool object and not on the Host
object.  The latter only gets used if the former does not exist, and
can still be set via the CLI.
CA-29230: Don't crash if VM name contains international character
CA-28819: Do not allow creation of SRs with empty name labels
Merge

CA-15025: Report an error if IP address of DNS server being added is invalid

Provides same response as you get if you try to set the mgmt IP
address to an invalid value.
